revised_title: Hydrated Platin-Cyanides and Temperature-Induced Color Changes
tldr: The author investigates the color changes in hydrated platin-cyanides when cooled in liquid air. They discover that the color change is due to variations in hydration and the arrangement of water molecules in the crystals. This study helps explain the phenomena observed in cooling certain hydrated salts and may have implications for the study of other colored salts at low temperatures.
